title: Sarong, 1900–68
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: wax resist dyeing (batik) on plain weave
description: A geometrical "ceplokkan motif", symmetrically arranged, covers the larger part of the sarong. One end is ornamented with the "tumpal" motif (row of isosceles triangles) and small floral designs. Narrow ornamental borders edge the four sides. Batiked in two shades of blue, light brown, and green (yellow over green).

tombstone.epitaph:
Sarong, 1900–68.
1900–68. Medium: cotton
Technique: wax resist dyeing (batik) on plain weave. Gift of Harvey Smith. 1968-135-94.
